intro: Byttneria scalpellata subsp. rigida, commonly known as the rigid byttneria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks. The subspecies is distinguished by its more rigid stem structure compared to other subspecies of Byttneria.
